Integrate search into a pkgdown website

Jay Hesselberth

Source: vignettes/search.Rmd

pkgdown websites can integrate search capability using Docsearch from Algolia. Docsearch is a powerful search engine that is free for documentation websites. There are only two steps needed to enable Docsearch on a pkgdown website.

1. Ask Docsearch to index your site.

Once you have published your pkgdown website, submit the pkgdown site URL to Docsearch. Docsearch will contact you via e-mail to confirm you are the website owner.

Docsearch will setup a crawler configuration that indexes your site every 24 hours. For example, this crawler config indexes the search capability for valr. If you want to optimize your search, they will accept pull requests to the configuration that incorporate additional options to fine tune the scraping.

2. Add Docsearch parameters to your site config.

Docsearch will e-mail you some JavaScript to integrate into your website.

<script type="text/javascript">
  docsearch({ 
    apiKey: 'API_KEY',  // a long hex string
    indexName: 'INDEX_NAME', 
    inputSelector: '### REPLACE ME ####', 
    debug: false // Set debug to true if you want to inspect the dropdown 
});

Put the value of the apiKey and indexName parameters into your site _pkgdown.yml:

template:
  params:
    docsearch:
      api_key: API_KEY
      index_name: INDEX_NAME

When you re-build your site using this new configuration, you should have a functional search bar in the navbar.

Contents

  • 1. Ask Docsearch to index your site.
  • 2. Add Docsearch parameters to your site config.

Developed by Hadley Wickham, .

Site built with pkgdown.
